markdownRemark.html:
Hi Friends üëã,

Welcome To aGuideHub!

To change font weight of mui typography in React js, you can use this code fontWeight="bold". It will change font weight of mui typography in react js.

Today, I am going to show you, how to change font weight of mui typography in react js.

Installation

Install the following packages to use mui typography in react js.

npm

npm install @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled

yarn

yarn add @mui/material @emotion/react @emotion/styled

Table of contents

  • Install MUI and create a new React app.
  • Import Material-UI Typography.
  • Change font weight of mui typography Component.

Step 1: Install MUI and create a new React app.

First you have to install the React project. You should use create-react-app command to create a new React project.

npx create-react-app my-app
cd my-app
npm start

Step 2: Import Material-UI Typography.

After installing MUI, you have to import your React component. To do this, add the following line to the top of your component file.

import { Typography } from '@mui/material';

Step 3: Change font weight of mui typography Component.

You can use the Typography component in your react js. For example, The typography component is used to create text. and use this code <Typography fontWeight="bold">. 

<Typography fontWeight="bold">
    This text will have a font weight of bold
</Typography>

MUI material change font weight of mui typography example.

The below code is an example, to make gradient color in Typography, you need to import Typography Component. You can use <Typography fontWeight="bold"> and it will change font weight.

App.js

import { Typography } from '@mui/material';

export default function MyComponent() {
  return (
    <Typography fontWeight="bold">
      This text will have a font weight of bold
    </Typography>
  );
}

In the above code example, I have used the @mui/material component and changed font weightmui typography in react js.

Check the output of the above code example.

Here, we are provided code sandbox links for the above program change font weight of mui typography in react js. Then you can use whenever you want and do the changes as per your requirements.

Try it Yourself

All the best üëç
